Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey in section, the interior is slightly ribbed, the exterior is covered with a brown slip, large area of light-brown paint and faint traces of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394801) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394801)
